text: A long stretch of road. Pretty damn lonely. We are way up there. Surrounded by dark trees and darker mountains.

A LONE WOMAN, sits road side, her car steaming. This we w get to know as SARA. Late 20s, pretty, vulnerable. A TOW TRUCK's red lights appear through the night mist casting an eerie glow across the road. The truck pulls up behind the car, the door opens and the driver steps out. This is CHASE JACKSON, 30 to 40, strong fellow. The two approach each other, stopping a few feet short.
Car trouble huh?
Nothing better at this time of night.
Well mam, let me see what I can do. Chase moves to the front of the car, looks it over as Sar watches over his shoulder.
Is it bad?
Could be worse. Busted water heater hose. Chase faces the woman, his eyes penetrating hers.
Expensive, huh? He looks her up and down. (CONTINUED)
Well, at this time of night, it might be extra costly.
(taken a bit by surprise) Oh really? You mean, you'll charge me more for a night call? It is obvious where Chase is going with this flirting.
Well, it's possible...I might be able to accept payment... in other ways. She seems to be giving in.
Well....this doesn't sound ethical. He moves in...very close.
Well, let's just call it a barter.
I see... Then the two engage in a long kiss. Sara pulls back and punches Chase in the chest
Chase...How could you let me go to work with a busted water hose?
(rubs his sore chest) Honey, I told you about that hose a week ago.
Telling me and fixing it are two different things.
What about all that women's 1ib?
I'm still happy being a woman thank you very much. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
woeRin wrong RAtGPngr ‘RW traditions in this life...Like the man fixing things. (beat) Who is watching Raquel? Chase moves back to his truck

You know for an twelve year old, she can almost run the shop herself. She's fine honey, she can get us on the CB if she needs to. Chase fishes through his TOOL BOX for a clamp and hose. And then we hear that _sound..... The HAUNTING CACKLE OF RADIO from his truck. It cuts through the rustic silence like a knife.
....hey...someone out there....anybody?... Chase Stands up slowly, wipes his hands. He listens as th radio once again goes silent, suddenly making his surroundings feel a lot more spooky.

(CRACK!) Somebody on the line?....Holy mother that thing was huge....moves like the wind too...bigger than a bear....Hello? Chase slowly moves towards the radio, as if it were alive He reaches across the seat and grabs a hold of the mic.
This is Chase Jackson. Who is that? Over. Nothing. He waits a moment, maybe hoping there will be no answer.
Come on back. Over. A beat. Then...
Hey....hey....What's your ten four? Chase jumps, sighs. (CONTINUED)
Highway twenty four, just east of Lonesome Trail. Another beat, maybe longer. Feels like it.
....Did you see it then? It's incredible. It's heading your way. Have you seen..... Nothing.
Hello? What's headed my way? Come back friend. Wham! A FLASH OF LIGHT hits Chase like a club. Sara stand near by with an OLD TIME VIDEO CAMERA, filming her husban playfully.
Geez honey...you can blind a guy with that thing. She smiles, shifts it around the area.

Grumpy husband...that's what you are. Grumpy, stubborn, wants to do things his way, full of pride. But you know what...you also believe in the best in life like no one I have ever known. No matter how bad times get, no matter how hard you want to resist..you always find a way to come shining through. He smiles and gets back to work. Her light crosses the forest, illuminating the thick trees in an eerie light.

This video camera was worth every penny... Suddenly SOMETHING HUGE MOVES THROUGH FRAME, in the thick Sara jumps, startled. Her eyes now riveted on the tree-li and what it holds. She moves, hypnotized towards where th disturbance was, across the highway, her camera still tra on the trees. Chase continues to fidget with his gear, not noticing. (CONTINUED)

Grumpy, huh? Why not? I support my family driving a tow truck. I live in a town that isn't even on some maps. My accomplishments I could count on one hand. Yeah, me grumpy...? Sara is still transfixed on what she saw in the dark, mov towards it. The air is almost completely SILENT. WHAM! A CAR smashes into her from out of nowhere! Chase spins...

Sara!!! Too late. Her body is thrown into the air. Chase runs to his wife in a panic, dropping to his knees her crumpled body. He cradles her easily in his lap, know damn well what is about to happen.

No sweetheart....no. Please don't go. Beside her is the camera. Battered and torn. The car weaves onward, it's drunken driver has no intenti of stopping. Chase watches his wife slip from him as he rocks her slow Her eyes reaching out to him.

Did you... see it?....Did you? Wasn't it...amazing...? And she is gone. Then..... something appears just ahead of him. Something the darkness, quiet but yet very overpowering. The huge figure appears to be standing upright, watching Chase fro the depths of the trees. It's breathing low, from the bow of the earth. Whatever it is....it is enough to draw Chase's attention it, his teary eyes straining in the night to see what his wive's eyes had. (CONTINUED)
The SHORT TITLES BEGIN as we hear the VOICE OF AN INTERVIEWER.
So, have you actually ever seen a Sasquatch? And then:

The kind of sleepy village you'd expect to find. The one where the local grocery store sponsors the yearly fair. Rustic but beautiful. Grandma-town. A WIRE-RIMMED GLASSES WEARING RED HEADED KID about 12, lo INTO LENS, the subject of an obvious news piece. We are seeing this through the grain of 16mm or the pixilation o video. A FESTIVITY IN THE BACKGROUND.

Yeah....I saw him once. He was stealing a chicken from our yard. He was big and scary and hairy. (beat) Then he got back on his giant space ship and flew back to outer space. (beat) And they had really bright lights.

We move through the town of Walnut Creek as our CREDITS R A Rockwellian picture. Not much has changed here. But lik Roswell, it is apparent this town has grown famous for something else: Bigfoot. Images, some absurdly humorous, the hairy man beast adorn everything from shoe stores to stations. A sign with the giant humanoid reads; HOME OF T FAMOUS JACKSON FOOTAGE. A tourist trap if there ever was one. And it's in full sw here as cars and trucks move down the small street, tooti their horns. It's NATIONAL BIGFOOT DAY, at least accordin to the sign in the hands of the guy in THE GORILLA SUIT. (CONTINUED)

Disposable cameras click away, capturing the town's big event. WE SEE THROUGH THE UNSEEN NEWS CREW'S CAMERA as they grab sound bites from THE MANY RESIDENTS who either shun or de heavily into the idea of Bigfoot roaming their land. All these home spun interviews are penetrated by QUICK BU of OLD BIGFOOT STYLE PHOTOS, Men holding giant feet casts sketches of what might be. There is also clips of SARA'S VIDEO FOOTAGE. That _night...in the dark. Something giant moving through the trees.

We are here in Walnut Creek, a once sleepy town awaken by the now famous video clip known in the Bigfoot community as the Jackson Footage. Captured by the late Sara Jackson who was killed in an accident that same night, it has become the Holy Grail in the cryptozoology circles, the greatest find in Sasquatch studies. Asa result, this once obscured village now shares in it's own kind of celebrity. The news crew approaches who we will get to know as Sheri HARRIS ZEFF, but you might not know it. The early side of 70, he is dressed in his civies. Probably past his prime the job here requires only so much from him. He seems a b uncomfortable on camera, but smiles all the same.

Have I seen him? Uh no sir I haven't. I have seen the occasional prankster in a monkey suit. But all this attention does put smiles on most people's faces here. Not to mention a few helpful tourist dollars. Next we see KEN ROBINSON. Deputy, 30s, dark features, fixated, his eyes scanning the area. The kind of guy that takes charge. He smiles, humoring the TV crew.
Sasquatch is a very old legend. Teddy Roosevelt even wrote about an apparent Sasquatch attack in his book back in 1890. The tradition hasn't died out yet. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) (nie KEMGRONTUDLy ) Now what does that tell you? It is obvious this town has finally earned a spot on the

A nice corner of the town. A TRADITIONAL FAMILY walks through frame. And then...like some demented Abbey Road satire a VERY differently dressed group enters THE FRAME. Dressed in black city-slick style, they clash with the surroundings like Rosie O'Donnel and a bikini.

The apparent leader we will come to know as TRAVIS JENSEN mid 40s, seasoned, the most focused. A SAMLL EAR CELL PHO hangs from his lobe. DUSTIN, 40, a slick competitor. Sauntering next to them is KAYLA KELLER. Let's just say s is the sexiest bank robber you ever saw. Then we have WAD and KYLE THOMPSON, 30s, street honed, trouble. These two brothers would be joined at the hip again if they could. They move across the street to a parking lot, grabbing so looks as they go. They pull around a corner, stop ina parking lot next to a beat up LINCOLN. wade turns to Kyle
What do you think, Chupacabra or Loch Ness Monster?
Easy Bro... The same thought hits their head.
Loch Ness. Loch Ness.
He'd swallow that goat sucker down like a shot of Tequilla.
Little critter might take ol Nessie's tonsils out on the way down.
Maybe Toho studios should make it. They haven't had a good one since... (CONTINUED)
...War Of The Gargantuas. ...War Of The Gargantuas.
What's with you guys anyway? Aren't you supposed to be identical twins to have all the ESP?
Usually, but it ain't an exact science. Some say..
...it's all baloney anyway. But.. The two hold up fists.
..it makes rock, paper, scissors a real bitch. The two both bang out "paper" with their hands and slap e other five.

Wish you guys were half as quiet as you were psychic.... (beat, holds up hand) Charlie, what ya got? Okay, buy a thousand shares at seven fifty. I don't care how high the PE is, buy it. I'ma buy and holder, you know that. Wouldn't sell unless my life depended on it. Check with you ina bit.
We stick out like Alice in Wonderland around here.
Won't much matter in... (looks to watch) Fifteen minutes. He opens the car trunk, begins PULLING OUT A CACHE OF WEAPONS, hands them to his crew.
Where's lover boy?  10.

The kind of place you'd expect to find in the middle of nowhere. Quiet, Uneventful. SIROM,30s, our local law man sits at the bar with his coffee moving at the speed of sy The kitchen door opens. Our BUXOM WAITRESS moves slightly disheveled over to Sirom's table. She fumbles for her not pad from her badly buttoned shirt, the name tag reads “PRISCILLA”.
Sorry about the wait, Sirom. You want some more coffee?
Naw. This should do me fine.
Well, have a good day Sirom. Say hi to Louise. Priscilla shrugs, licks her lipstick smeared lips, and mo down the diner.
Priscilla moves through the hall, into the darker kitchen PAIR OF TATTOOED ARMS WRAP AROUND HER, COVER HER MOUTH.
Shhhhhhhhh. The man steps back and into the light. LUKE STEWART is 30 a shirt louder than his personality. Years of tortured fl wrapped around a child. He taps his gun against his thigh

Take off your top. Priscilla watches him closely, starts to take off her shi Luke stares as she gets down to her skirt and bra. He mov over to her, grabs her face and kisses her hard. He pulls back, after a beat....she blows a bubble.
You don't get tired do you?
Don't put off tomorrow what you can do today. (CONTINUED)
He grabs her in another embrace, throwing her down on the table.
I got customers out there.
They can wait a second.
A second? Guess you really don't wait for tomorrow, do you? (beat) Hey Luke, you really going to come back to take me out of here? Luke smiles, sort of sweetly.
Baby, have I ever lied to you?
I guess not in the whole four days I known you.
Harris is locking up the PHARMACY, hangs the sign up BACK 30 MINUTES.
Sheriff! Harris turns as Ken approaches.
Closing up the store?
Well, got a call from Ms. Starr and she said she got herself a car blocking her drive way. Going to see if I can figure out whose it is.
Sheriff, I'd be more than happy to take care of it for you. (beat, smiles) Besides, you put in your four hours of duty today. (CONTINUED)
Harris returns a half smile, some pride taken out of his sails.
I know those insurance companies don't like me putting in more than a couple hours under my badge, but I'm still the sheriff. Turning seventy ain't a death warrant.
(recovering) Sir...I just mean...I know you can do it...I just wanted to help if you wanted to keep the store open. Harris places a hand on Ken.
You can help by backing me up as Ms. Starr can get pretty ornery sometimes. Ken smiles and the two set off down the street to Harris' TRUCK.
The band of would-be robbers step from the shadows of the local store just outside the bank. Travis sizes up the qu establishment.
Looks good. Every one on their game?
As long as that boy Luke is here on time.
He'll be here. Better we don't have a damn car sitting in front of the bank too long.
So we got three cameras, no guard...
...and five hundred grand with our names on it. (CONTINUED)
And it's all supposed to go out tomorrow morning. But we didn't come all the way out to Jerkwater for nothing. Easy enter, easy exit.
Let's go. I need some excitement after hanging around you guys. The crew take one last look around the empty street and s towards the bank...their masks going on as they near the doors.
Priscilla is fixing her shirt while Luke sits on the stov lighting a cigarette off the flames. He now sports a hat says "I Lie To Girls".
I never been to New York before.
Yeah? Well, you'll love it there. Got buildings and everything.
Will we get a house with a big yard and a dog? Luke blows a cloud of smoke.
Baby, I'm the silver car to your future and you are just need to sit back and enjoy the ride. She smiles, loving the crap coming from his mouth. She notices the time.
Ah...one o'clock. I got to sweep the floor. Luke jumps up.
One o'clock!? Damn. I got to go baby. (CONTINUED)
He starts to grab his stuff while Priscilla scrambles for pen and paper.
Well...you'll come back soon, won't you?
Yeah...yeah...you bet ya. She scribbles something down and hands it to the hurried young man.
Here's my number. Sometimes my momma answers but she'll get me for ya. (kisses him) Call me soon. I'll be dreaming of that day we drive out of here for good. Luke touches her face sweetly.
Don't you worry none. Your kingdom awaits princess. He jets out the door, leaving Priscilla among all the pot and pans.

Luke moves from the store and over to the waiting VAN. He checks the surroundings and hops in. Starts the engine takes a look at Priscilla's number, kisses the paper and throws it into the wind. The van speeds off and Sirom steps out to watch it go....
Luke's van pulls up to the front of the van. His eyes dar back and forth on the street. Inactive. Perfect. He reaches up and strokes the FUZZY DI on the mirror as he slowly pulls up to the front.
Come on seven. Once parallel with the window, he peers in. (CONTINUED)

Through the window we see what must be Wade and Kyle animatedly waving their guns around the room at the few PATRONS on the floor. Kayla carries TwO BIG BAGS in her hand, motioning to the others. Luke begins to put on the mask when he notes in the side mirror....Sirom! The cop is walking slowly towards the va from across the street.
This really sucks. He looks to the mask and then his face in the mirror.
Mask scenario or face scenario? Mask scenario or face scenario? (beat) Face. He jumps out of the van, faces Sirom, acting confused.

Officer, thank god you are here. I have been driving around in circles left and right...well of course if I'm driving in circles it's got to be left and right...but I am looking for how to get back to New York.
Your blinker wasn't working.
I'm sorry. My blinker? Thanks. I'll get that fixed in the very next town.
I have to write you a ticket. Sirom pulls a PAD, starts to write. Luke turns to the ban sees the group scattering by the window.
Can I get a warning? (CONTINUED)
Got to enforce these things. Sorry son. The doors bust open. Luke turns to Sirom and shrugs.
I'm sorry too. Luke punches Sirom as the group moves from the bank to th van. Travis sees the cop.
What are you doing Luke?!
Watching TV. What do you think?
He saw your face.
You don't like my face? The group moves into the van quickly. Sirom rolls over, moans as he pulls his gun, fires, break out the van window. Sirom gets to his feet, his gun still firing.

Stop! Kyle sticks his gun through the window and shoots...hitti Sirom in the chest! As the van speeds off through a group of screaming people Sirom falls to the warm cement, his blood staining the asphalt pretty quickly.

A gas station whose clock stopped working around the 1969 rests just off the side of the road. An S.U.V. Pulls up to the pumps. The door opens and we se ERIN PRICE, late 20s. A face to fall in love with but eye that look like they have seen the bad side of that alread Erin stretches a moment and then turns to her finger. (CONTINUED)

An ENGAGEMENT RING, catches the light of the sun. She sta at it, begins to slowly push it off her finger with her thumb...then stops. She sighs and turns to... A LONG TABLE, displaying an array of GOODIE, ANTIQUES AND TRINKETS. Including a VIDEO TAPE....one we may have seen before. She walks over to all of it.
That's a special tape. Erin turns to see RAQUEL JACKSON, 20s, country pretty. Blonde hair and blue eyes that make you want to smile. In her coveralls, she moves over to Erin.
Special? Raquel moves over, extends her hand.
Raquel.
(shakes hand) Erin. (beat) Raquel?
My daddy loves Raquel Welsh. I mean, he loved my momma too, but you know men.
Yeah... Erin gives a half smile, something in that comment maybe tearing at her. Erin picks up the tape.
So, what's special about this?

This tape is kind of infamous, or even famous depending on who you talk to. They call it the Jackson Footage. For better or for worse, kind of put this little town on the map. You might have even caught a piece of it on TV at one time or another. (CONTINUED)
Erin is now curious as to where this girl is going.
It's the last thing my mother ever saw before she was killed. Erin reacts to this, her attention now locked.

And in some ways, it's now the first thing my father ever seems to remember. (beat) It only lasts a couple seconds, and kind of hard to see as is usually the case, but there is something there. Maybe a bear, someone in a suit...but it's there. (Raquel tries to remain strong) It's grabs your attention, like it did my mother that night. Erin, lost in the moment, wanting to hear more, begins to speak when Raquel snaps back into today, pulling out of t past, laughs.
You want me to fill her up?
Uh...yeah. Please. Raquel moves to the pumps while Erin watches her go.
Erin climbs into the car as Raquel finishes pumping the g and moves to the window. Erin pays her.
Here ya go.
Thanks. So where you running to? Erin almost looks caught in the headlights.
"Running to"? (CONTINUED)
Raquel nods to the sealed boxes in the back seat, taped u a hurry.

Not that I'm being nosey...well, maybe a bit. I watch a lot of those detective shows. I saw all them boxes taped up like you were in arush. But everything else in your car looks so neat. Made me think you aren't sloppy so you must have been in a real hurry. Erin laughs, knowing she has been pegged.

That is pretty good. Yeah....Guess I am in a hurry. Trying to leave one life behind and start a new one. (beat, plays with ring) Maybe I was in too much of a rush. Raquel looks at Erin, thinks a beat and then hands her th tape.

You take this. I really don't know what I could have sold this for It would have either been too much or not enough. I think if anyone should take this out of my life it's someone who knows how to move on. (re: The Indian Totem) I'll even toss this in for free. For luck.
Thanks. That means a lot.

Believe me, my pleasure. Erin begins to drive off. She stops a moment at the road when she notices something. She tilts her rear view mirro to see the side of the gas station. Standing there, watching her leave, is a man, 50s. Partia obscured by the screen door. His piercing gaze hits her e from there. This is CHASE JACKSON, twenty years older sin we last saw him. (CONTINUED)
THE ECHO OF GUN SHOTS ring out in the distance. Erin turn to listen a moment and when she turns back, she sees Chas he disappears around the back. Erin shrugs and drives off

We PAN ACROSS the beautiful landscape of this mountain oa but the view soon turns into something not so beautiful.. The totem from Erin's vehicle lies broken on the ground. catch pieces of smoking metal before getting to the first automobile carcass. On it's side, is Erin's truck, its body already engulfed flames!

Erin's eyes flutter open. Blood drips down from her forehead. She looks through her cracked windshield and se Another car up on a rock. Wade stumbles around aimlessly. The window is kicked open as Travis moves out with Kayla. Flames erupt around Erin's cab. She reaches for her seat belt, releases it, drops to the ground and looks to A BACKPACK at her feet. She tosses it to the ground outside As she scrambles to get out, she notices a hand grabbing backpack. As she moves towards the window, the same hand suddenly reaches in and yanks her out.
Dragged from the burning vehicle she looks up to her savi and sees Luke's bloody face, her backpack in his hand.
How ya feel?
I...I don't know. Okay, I guess.
You got insurance? Luke laughs, drops the backpack and moves off. Erin looks around her, the scene growing more surreal by the second. (CONTINUED)
Travis and Kayla begin pulling automatic weapons from the van, Dustin is scrambling to stuff some CASH laying on th ground into the bag. Kyle is laying motionless on the ground.
Grab the money Wade! But Wade is to focused on his bloody brother.
Kyle! He moves towards his fallen body, shakes him.
Get up! Come on get up! Kyle! As Erin moves to her feet, Kayla moves towards her.
(to Kayla) Are you okay? Kayla answers with a front kick to Erin's stomach, droppi her.
Just fine. How are you? Wade turns to Erin, fire in his eyes as he pulls his gun!
I'll kill you. I'1l kill you! Luke jumps in, grabs the gun hand as it goes off into the air.
Let go you ass!
Wade. Stay cool.
Travis, Kyle is dead! My brother! Because of this bitch. Travis points his gun at wade. (CONTINUED)
Don't question me. He's dead. I'm sorry. We got to move. Wade is frothing at the mouth as he turns to Luke.

Don't touch me you crazy bastard! I never wanted you here in the first place... He shoots Erin a death glance and turns back to his broth Erin slowly gets to her feet, the gravity of the scene sinking in. Dustin starts laughing.
Something funny to you Dustin?
Yeah it is. This is sucha metaphor of your life Travis. One frickin car wreck to another.
Shut your mouth Dustin.

I don't feel sorry for your brother, Wade. No one here can feel sorry for anyone. Not me, not you and especially not Travis. We'd all turn on each other for an extra dollar and you know it. Travis shoves Dustin to the ground.

I take it the crash got you thinking funny. Whatever redeeming qualities we pissed away in our lives, there is one that has to remain. Loyalty. Because without that... were just some kind of animal. (beat, moves closer) Right now, I am grasping for every bit of it like a desperate man. Dustin, brushes off the dirt and stands. (CONTINUED)
I'm not interested in being your salvation Travis.
Here comes John Wayne. They turn to Luke on top of the over turned car, he point down the road. Ken's SQUAD CAR followed by Harris' truck quickly approahes.
Everyone load up. (re: Erin) Grab her. Luke moves to the others as Kayla yanks up Erin.
Who are you?

Just your friendly neighborhood bank robbers. Ken's car and the truck pull up to a skidding halt. They jump from their vehicles, weapons drawn. They are joined CRAIG STONE, young and probably never really sure why he this job. His uniform unbuttoned, sloppy. STANLEY VAUGHN the new one of the bunch, ready for the next step. And he about to get it.
Geez...there they are! There they are! The ones that killed Sirom. Harris cocks his shot gun.
Stan, keep your head. Ken, you see anything? Ken is tucked behind his car.
More than four. They might have a female hostage.
Damn. What the hell we do? These are real bank robbers. (CONTINUED)
Harris takes a breath, his men looking to him. He moves t his CAR MOUNTED BULLHORN.

This is Sheriff Harris Zeff. Throw out your weapons and release the hostage. Let's keep from shedding any more blood. Behind the over turned S.U.V., The crew wait huddled for orders from Travis. Their attention drawn to the new thre Dustin spots a WAD OF CASH and grabs it. He then takes a beat and moves quietly to the mountain edge....and disappears.
There's only four of them.
That's a nice truck too. Toyota with an eight inch lift.

Guess we could use the ride. (beat, touches ear phone) Hey Charlie...How much is it? Okay, buy two thousand shares then. Listen, got to go. (looks at the cops) Okay, let's try not to hit anything but the cops. And then they begin to unload! Bullets bounce off of the hood of the car and truck as th local law hits the ground.
They're shooting! They're shooting! Craig drops behind his truck.

Stan you got a damn knack for stating the obvious. Ken returns fire. The chain reaction begins and bullets a flying everywhere. Harris begins to fire with his shot gu which takes pieces off of the SUV. (CONTINUED)
Behind the SUV, Wade takes a quick look around, notes the missing Dustin.
Travis. Dustin's gone! Travis looks the area over, frowns. As the cops continue to fire, Harris throws his hands up.
Seize fire! Ken watches, or more appropriately listens, carefully. Harris gets back on his bullhorn, clears his throat.
Listen up. We don't want any more getting killed. What do you say we talk? No response.
What are they waiting for? Should we keep shooting?

Sheriff? Harris takes a breath then looks into the cab of his truc and sees: A DUSTY KOREAN WAR MEDAL, hanging from the viso Next to that, a photo, somewhere in the 1950s, of Harris his WIFE. A past long gone. He takes a breath and moves forward into the street, his held high.
Sheriff! What are you doing?
Cover me.
Sheriff..wait..Damn. Ken quickly takes up another position, covering, as Harri moves across the road, vulnerable in the open. (CONTINUED)

Harris tries to maintain his breathing, tapping into an ancient instinct. He looks to the other car, into the windshield. No reflections. He pops around the overturned car and sees...nothing. They're gone! He quickly moves to the edge of the road an looks down. The open range dwarfs the small group of robbers as they vanish into the dense trees below. Harris catches his breath.
They're in the timber! The men move over to him quickly, looking over the small perimeter. Craig is pumped.
Wow. Wow. We got ourselves some real damn bad guys!
Should I get Gary on the horn and get back up?
Tell him we need everyone. Make sure that Eli closes up the Hardware store and brings all his rifles out here. Stanley moves off. The others look to the vast forest ahead of them.
That's some bad country their in.
Your right about that.

Dustin moves quickly through the trees, his breath and footsteps out doing each other with noise. He finally stops....listens. The silence surrounds him. Nothing but tall trees above him. He smiles. Free at last. SNAP! A twig breaks. Dustin pulls his gun. His untrained eyes scan the green wall around him. Nothing. He moves a further....  27.

Travis, Erin and the others (minus Luke) move through the trees. It is obvious that none of this is indigenous to a of them. They are in new territory. Kayla maintains close contact with Erin, then turns to wade.
I always thought Dustin was a loser.
Well, it's too late now.
Which way do we go?
Straight. The border can't be more than a few miles from here. Better than getting trapped on that road until more of their boys show up.
I can't tell, left from right in this damn amazon.
Just leave me behind. I'm no good to you.
You may be if they come after us. Kayla looks around.
Where's boy toy? The others turn to look, Luke is no where in sight.
Where the hell is he?
Luke! A beat and then...WHAM! A body drops in front of them...o his feet. Luke has just jumped from a tree to the side of them. (CONTINUED)
You freak! What are you doing?

Sight seeing. The law dogs seem to have company comin'. We should move. Luke looks to Erin and smiles. She turns her head. Luke moves ahead, dancing through the mud puddles as he goes. Erin takes a look behind them, the forest now completely closed around them. She looks to Kayla.
You look nervous there sweetheart Erin makes a noise that could be a laugh.
Funny, so do you. Erin moves ahead, leaving Kayla to ponder what she has sa as the trees seem to close around them.

A BEAT UP TRUCK pulls up to the other officers. Jumping f the creaky door is ELI, 50s and as rusty as his truck. He carries a HIGH POWERED RIFLE in one hand and a LONG SPORT BAG WITH RIFLES in the other. He heads to Harris, hands h the bag as the two move towards the clearing.
Eli, you got here quick.
Was just down the hill helping van Cleef get his trailer out the mud. Heard the call. These the bastards that shot up Sirom?
Yeah.
Got ourselves some wild ones.
(notes something) Where the dogs? (CONTINUED)
Craig catc They stop turns to E This hits 29.

Curse your timing Harris. Both them girls are getting their canines cleaned and are flying high on somethin' the doc gave ‘em. Don't worry, ain't nothing they can smell that I can't anymore. hes up with them.
We got to move on this now, they got themselves a hostage.
You'll be eating my dust ol' boy. I'll have them tagged and bagged before dinner. at the hill, looking into the thick forest. Ken li, hands him a WALKY TALKY.
You know this terrain?
Here? No one knows this area. Not even funny monkey man.
You talking about crazy old Chase Jackson? Harris somewhere.
Hey, watch where your mouths boys.
Geez Harris, he thinks his dead wife filmed a monster and then he turns this whole town into a tourist freak show.
Chase is a good man. He lost himself a lot. Just looking for his way...like the rest of us. (CONTINUED)
(re: his rifle) Me and the old lady will be all you'll need. I'll get myself ahead of them by night.
They're dangerous Eli. Just lead the way. Eli starts down the hill, not waiting.
Hey..slow up you old fool. Eli flips him off without turning around.
I'll leave you children some markers where to find me. Harris passes one rifle to Ken and hangs on to the other.
Here ya go Ken. Your the best shot.
Harris! I can shoot that boy under the table... Harris ignores him, turns to Stanley.
Stanley, you stay and wait here until back up arrives. Ken turns to Harris.
Sheriff, you might want to stay yourself. Let Craig and I go. Harris looks to him, avoids the statement.
We're going into Dark Territory. Cell phones and radios will last about a mile. Let's get some flare guns. Craig smiles, ready for a change. (CONTINUED)
Hell yeah. This is better than parking ticket detail. Time to put some real miles on these badges. The three move towards the mountain awaiting them.
The bad guy crew moves upon a RAPID RIVER, dissecting the area with a heavy current.
Damn.
Which way Travis? Left or right? You brought us out into this damn place.
Wade..... You just take the steps I take, swing your stick the way I do and as always you'll have some pocket change to blow on your cars and whores. Wade moves off, pissed, leans against a tree.
It was Kyle that liked the whores. Travis sighs and looks the area over.
(to Erin) Thirsty?
No.
Well, I am. As he opens the pack he pulls out some plastic bottled wa
Ah...the French stuff. (beat) Is this poisoned? (laughs at himself) That's a French joke. (CONTINUED)
(dry) That's a good one. He takes a sip and offers it to her again. She only stare he shrugs and stuffs the bottle back in.
A YELLOW MARKER tied to the tree. The lawmen grab it, Har on the radio.
Eli, we got your markers. Where you at? Over.
Working my way around, think I'm already ahead of them. If you hurry your slow butts up, we can intercept them. Over.
Just keep your distance. Over and out.
They're really burrowing themselves in there. Moving north. Probably the border.
Radio Stanley, find out where the back up is. Ken gets on the walky.
Stanley, you on? Over. The STATIC from the radio now apparent.
..-Yeah...It's me. Over.
Any luck with our back up? Over.
...We have a bit of a problem...over. (CONTINUED)
What problem is that? Over.
Stanley is on the side of the road. He paces around nervously, not sure what to do next.

Well, it's just they can't get no choppers up here to help until late tomorrow. They said they can have a full out border patrol waiting for them to get through. That...and I'm still alone up here. Over.
...SO....we are....all on our own now? Over.
Your breaking up. (beat) They recommended you come back, not go any deeper. Over.
....they....hostage...... The radio turns to a mush of static.
What? Can't hear you? Over. Nothing. Silence. Stanley frowns, looks around on at his lonely surroundings.
This isn't good.
Eli moves through the trees, he looks to the ground, spot the tracks conspicuously in the mud. A cocky grin crosses his face as he ties a YELLOW MARKER to the tree.
You dumb fools. Walking yourselves right into the mouth of Satan.
(CONTINUED)

Something in the forest. Eli spins, his reflexes still go He presses up against a tree, watching the foliage for an movement. His NOSTRILS FLARE, smelling something that doesn't sit right with him. After a moment of silence, Eli stands and then makes his after the robbers, but his senses now on Def Con 2. Eli ties another MARKER to the tree and continues on when once again....he stops. The trees around him giving no sign of what may have caug his attention. He looks as confused as we have seen this coot. Then a SOUND...not a branch, not the wind....but somethin like a deep, deep, strained BREATHING. Eli cocks his gun, moves ahead. As he raises his head over some bushes his eyes begin to widen like nothing we have ever seen before. Something amazing going on in front of him making him shake like a little boy. Then the SOUND..._A SMALL ANIMAL CRYING....
My god....This can't be... We see the walky clutched in his startled hand and then, something moves BEHIND HIM...
As the group of robbers walk along the river...
The group looks ahead, suddenly very on edge.
That does not sound very good.
Harris and his posse hear the same sounds, their guns at ready.
The hostage? (CONTINUED)
Then...their walky screams to life...literally! ELI'S SCREAMS jump from the small device in a rush of static. T lawmen react as once again it goes suddenly dead.
What the hell? Harris gets on the walky.
Eli come in..... Eli.... The others look to him.
A small man made bridge crosses the water to the other si The group of robbers stops. Travis looks back up the rive shakes his head.
You don't think that screaming was Dustin do you?
Can't tell.
We're walking right towards it.
Yeah. Erin turns to look at Luke who is crouched on a rock, kee an eye on the forest, the backpack still on his shoulder.
I'm just holding you back you know.
I'm not having a problem with you.
Your on your way out of here now. Let me go back. Luke looks to her ring.
Got a fiance' waiting for you? This almost angers her. (CONTINUED)
What I got waiting for me is none of your business. She turns from him coldly. Wade stands near the river, his face in an almost glazed stare.
Rock, paper, scissors. Wade looks up quickly.
Kyle? The others turn to him.
What? Wade takes a breath, noting no one seems to have heard wh he did.
Nothing. Travis looks to the ground, noting A LARGE HOLE leading d to the water below. He motions to it.
Wade, cover this.

Dustin, disheveled and tired, moves to the water where he bends down and begins to slowly rub his hands in the wate watching the dirt and grime flow from his finger tips. He pulls them out and begins to caress it over his face, cleansing what filth he can from himself. He lets his eyes settle on the river bed as the ripples f away and his face begins to take shape in the reflection. stares a moment at himself, shakes his head.
We'll never be clean enough. Then Dustin takes a whiff...something irritating his nostrils.
(CONTINUED)

As he takes a sigh, his gaze still on his reflection, the water instantly fills with a new configuration...one that passes Dustin menacingly. Dustin turns, his gun out. Nothing there. He then moves o through the river.
Harris, Ken and Craig show up at the area where the bridg was. Harris leans against the tree, taking in some much needed breather. Craig holds up the walky.

We haven't seen one of Eli's damn markers in a mile and he's not answering this thing. Harris knows this isn't good. Craig raises the radio and turns it on again. STATIC! Ken bends down, checks the ground.
They all crossed here. Craig laughs.
Damn Robinson, even I can tell those prints are going that way and I ain't no injun. Ken moves over to Craig.
Craig, you got anything else in that skull of yours beside stereo type?
I got lots in my skull. Just saying us rednecks got as much common sense as you red skins.
Fine. Lead the way.
With pleasure. (CONTINUED)

Craig takes a couple steps and what follows is simultaneo Craig's foot steps right into the covering over the hole begins to go in....just As Ken grabs his arm, preventing inevitable fall. Craig looks down, swallows. Ken then let's him go as he regains his footing and turns to Harris, who is leaning a against a tree. Ken moves to him and Harris stops him.
Just catching my breath. (beat) Let's head down river, we'll find a crossing. The trio move quickly down river.
Stanley is on the car radio, looks to the sky, anxious.
We got ourselves a real situation here Freddy! I'm all by myself out here and it's getting late.
On a hill top, somewhere else, A CB RADIO on the ground continues the transmission from Stanley.

Harris is out there with them. I know, I know. Just tell Judy I'm sure he'll be home for dinner. WE PULL BACK to see the back of A MAN (CHASE). In his han LARGE KNIFE. He sticks it in the log and grabs the radio.

The group of bank thieves move through the visibly more confusing area of trees. Hard to get a lead on which way are going. Branches cross their faces like crooked claws. They reach a small clearing, Travis rests his rifle again tree, he is hitting his ear phone.
Damn cell reception. Need to get this stop loss in before the market opens. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

CONTINUED: (beat ) TRAVIS(CONT'D) Let's take a breath here. Luke, why don't you pass our little friend's water around. Luke reaches into the pack and begins to pull out the wat He scrounges through it.
You got a sandwich in there or something.
Couple trail bars.
(frowns) Healthy stuff? He pulls out the tape from Raquel, smiles.
Porn? She shakes her head at him.
The three cops move through the woods, straining to see w the SMALL FLASHLIGHTS they have.
Hey Robinson.
Yeah.
You think your ancestors going to give us a blessing or something. You know, from up there in the great big sky. Ken leans closer to his smiling comrade.

Craig, my mother was white. My father was Chinese. The only Indian I ever knew was the one that ran the cigar shop on Alvarado and 13th. Ken leans back to get some rest, Craig left stupified. (CONTINUED)
I...I always thought you were an Indian. Harris smiles, then.... Splat! He looks down, something h has stepped in.
What in the world...? The others look to his feet and see what he is looking at GOOEY, WET WEB mixed with what can only be...blood.
What is that? Ken moves to it, looks it over. His face frowns.
If there wasn't so much, I'd say....it's after birth.
That's really gross man.
But this is way too much.
Bear?
I guess. But still... CRUNCH! They spin, guns ready.
What was that?
Don't know.... They move slowly towards the bushes, cautious. Harris reaches out, grabs a branch and pulls it back. There seem to be nothing there and then....ELI'S BODY FALLS OUT!
Oh my God! Look at him. Harris moves over to Eli, looks him over, feels the loss another fallen soldier. (CONTINUED)
Sorry old boy. (beat) Looks like he was beaten to death. No bullet holes. Harris looks up.
What did those crazy sum bitches do?
Can't figure. Beat him pretty good. Ken moves back in.
Nothing's out there.
This ain't right, this ain't right. Ken moves over to Harris, checks Eli out as well, smells body, pulls back.
Strange smell...
What are we going to do? We gota dead body. I mean this is a real dead body! Harris stands, grasps Craig's shoulder, his leadership starting to show.

Easy. Don't focus on him. Focus on what we need to do. We'll have to leave him here. We head back out and find these people before they can do this again. The three men look to each other, knowing they are in the fight of their lives.  42.
The group of thieves are taking a nervous rest. Wade stan over by a tree, his breathing quick, erratic. Almost paranoid. The ghostly voice returns.
She killed me. Wade shakes his head, snaps towards Erin.
She's just holding us back Travis.
He's right about that Travis. Dead weight. What do we need her for?
Look, we need all the bargaining chips we can. Wade moves towards Erin.
If it weren't for this stupid bitch we'd be in Canada by now. Luke, sitting on a rock, sticks his leg out as Wade passe and trips him. Wade hits the ground, pissed.

Watch your step around here. He is up on his feet and charges Luke! The two go flying against a tree. Luke spins out of Wade's grip and takes h down. Kayla smiles, enjoying the show as the sound of combat ec in the valley.

Break it up. They don't listen. Travis starts to move in on them when. CRASH! A tree, or something, crashes into another tree. T branches above shaking. Suddenly all is forgotten as ever one goes for their guns. The group goes silent, listening
What is that smell? (CONTINUED)
Snap! Another branch and Wade unloads his gun! BANG, BANG
A_ SOUND follows the shooting....a weird sound. Almost A SCREAM...
Harris, Ken and Craig all stop. The SOUND OF GUNFIRE dyin in the distance.
That's not too far.
What are they shooting? An army? Harris grows concerned.
Let's hurry.
Travis moves to Wade.
Hold it! Stop firing! (beat) How many damn bullets you shoot there Wade?! Wade stops, his face registering the same as everyone els
What was that? You hear that noise?
Well111111....let's go see. Kayla pokes Erin along as everyone moves slowly through t bush. Clearing a broken tree, Travis notes something and motion
There, on the tree. The others look and see dripping from the tree like red sap...BLOOD. It drips to the ground where we see a trail it leading into the forest. (CONTINUED)
A PATCH OF DARK HAIR floats through the crimson.
That's a lot of blood.
Human?
(relaxing) Wade...you hit yourself your first bear, I think? Wade laughs.
Got that right. Wade turns back to Luke, points at him.
Don't screw with me again. As the group enjoy their moment of relief, Erin moves bac slowly in the bushes...and bolts!

Erin moves through the trees as fast as her legs will car her. Twigs snap below her feet, branches slap against her face. Her muscles pound into the dirt like an Olympic sprinter and then... A BROWN MASS Crosses in front of her! She stumbles, hits the ground. Erin rolls over, her eyes darting around where the intruder just was. Nothing. Her heart beats through her chest. Footsteps! She turns..... Luke catches up to her, his gun hand.
Woah, you run fast for a chick. Erin continues to look the area over, not entirely sure w she saw. Luke waves the gun.
You're not going to make me chase you again are you? (MORE) (CONTINUED)
Cuz, I might KRRONT Bhoot you in the foot or something. Erin stands.
We need to go back.
Sorry...
(forceful) You don't understand. This is wrong. This whole thing is wrong. Can't you feel it? (beat) You guys have made a big mistake.
Ya think?
This all funny to you? What's wrong with you people. Does any of this look like it's getting better and better?
Just don't do that again so I can get you back safely to your future husband. Erin throws a punch that lands on Luke's jaw! He pulls ba stunned.

Don't talk about my life! You've got no right to even mention my life. You don't give a damn about yours, so what do you care about mine? Erin doesn't wait for Luke as she heads past him, back to others. Luke follows and we WE PULL UP to see what they j walked through: FOOTPRINTS! Big ones, and definitely not bear.
Raquel moves back and forth between the dining room and t kitchen. Some great dinner made by hand. (CONTINUED)

She is setting two places. In the background, the screen door between her and the great outdoors. As she passes it maybe a third time, what was once not th now is! A large figure silhouetted by the moonlight, something huge in it's hand. Raquel jumps! She then relaxes.

Dad...what are you doing out there? Supper's ready. The figure opens the door and a shaft of light catches Chase's face. On closer look, we see a strong face, handsome. His lips smile but something in his eyes is not happy. Raquel pours some wine.
Make sure and close that screen door, the mosquitos are terrible right now. Chase nears the table, smiles.
Smells good. As always.
Well, I learned a few things right from Mom and this is one of them. Where you been anyway? Chase takes a seat, grabs a fork.
Was up on the mountain. Raquel stops, looks to his father and then to the dark sh laying on the porch.
Why were you out there again daddy? She moves slowly towards the screen door, staring at the large object.
Just checkin for traps. Poachers still wandering around there. (CONTINUED)
Daddy....what is that? She gets to the door and notes the BODY OF A LARGE BUCK laying outside.
Deer.
You shoot it...?
No. Found it out there. It's neck broke. Raquel moves back to the table.
Why'd you bring it back here?
Because....something gutted it tore out the insides. Just wanted to look him over, that's all. Raquel sighs.
Look him over? (shakes her head) Just taking a scientific curiosity? Chase gets a bit worked up.
Look...something killed the deer. I just want to make sure it ain't some bunch of kids, that's all. She smiles, touches his hand.

Dad, there are a lot of mysterious to life. Some you can explain some you can't. Mom's death you are just going to have to explain, because the longer you keep it a mystery to yourself, you'll never stop looking. (CONTINUED)
Chase bites his lip, she has hit a nerve. He delicately touches her back but holds the other force deep inside.

Chase moves through the living room, stopping by a window Next to him is a bookshelf, a CB RADIO CACKLES on the she Chase looks over his shoulder and realizing he's alone he reaches behind a ROW OF BOOKS and pulls out a small book, begins flipping through it. Then the radio grabs his attention....

tee This is Deputy Stanley Vaughn....We just saw the first flare....still out in the woods. We're positioned at Grizzly Peak...We need those choppers by morning.... As Chase listens, Raquel steps in from behind, startling
Sorry daddy.
It's okay. You can startle your crazy old man anytime.

I don't think your crazy daddy. I never did. I just didn't like leaving the door open in our lives for other people to think that way. Whatever you saw that day, whatever was on that tape, doesn't matter to me. You put us on the map. You're a good man and it's not right having everyone we pass in the street lookin at you like you anything but.
Don't matter what anybody thinks. Your all that matters to me. And I promise I won't drag you into anything like that again. She smiles, nods.
Okay, well night daddy. (CONTINUED)

Night sweetheart. She steps back into the hallway and Chase looks out the window, his mind racing. He drops the book on the window sill and quickly moves off. We finally get a good look at the book and see SASQUATCH: FICTION OR FACT. The ominous image on the front grabbing attention.
The group pushes through the trees. Erin and Kayla walk s by side. Kayla smirks.
You know, some of us don't have the luck of being born or married into money. So we look for the only other way to get it.
You think somebody owes you?

(laughs) Honey, we all think somebody owes us. I can look at you in two minutes and tell you think somebosy owes you something. It may not be cash...but it's something. Erin breaks away from her and pushes up to Travis.
You have any idea where your going Davy Crockett? Travis snorts, looks her up and down.
Well, I know where I could be sending you so maybe just keep the tough girl attitude down to a whisper.
Pee break. Travis stops. (CONTINUED)

Alright, let's take a minute. Luke moves off. Erin watches him go as he turns back to h and winks. Then, something grabs her attention. A PEBBLE lands near her arm. She looks around, trying to figure out where it came from. Then, it happens again. Th time she turns her head behind the trees and sees.... Ken! His finger pressed to his lips. He beckons her to mo away. She takes a beat and slowly, casually starts to move from camp. Luke stands over the bushes, looks down and stops in his tracks. Below him, gun aimed straight up, is Harris.
Aw hell.
Sshhhhhh.....
Hurry it up Luke, we need to get a move on.
Go ahead...answer him.
You bet Sam. Travis looks up, suddenly very alert at Luke's response. looks to Kayla

Grab the girl. Kayla moves quickly towards Erin. Erin sees this and move towards her backpack, grabbing it just as Kayla nears her That's when the first shots ring out at Kayla's feet She suddenly dives for Erin, both of them hitting the gro Craig rises up shooting towards Wade as the crook dives f his gun. Travis opens fire. (CONTINUED)
Luke drops into a back roll, out of Harris's immediate si

Hey.... Harris is on his feet now, shooting. Kayla yanks Erin further back into the forest Travis grabs the bag of cash. Wade pulls back as the area is torn up around him. Luke goes for his gun over by the tree....Just_ as Ken's comes down on it! Luke sighs and relaxes...then explodes upward, taking Ken against a tree! The gun falls from Ken hand and the two men engage in a vicious "street" brawl throwing each other around in a frenzy. At one point, Ken as Luke pinned against a tree and a noi almost sounds like a GROWL, grabs both their attention. They pause a beat, but Luke is the first to recover, figh back once again.
Harris moves through the woods, his breathing heavy. He charges ahead, focused.
Luke and Ken continue to fight when Craig appears, his gu drawn.
Freeze right there or I'll shoot you dead! The two dogs, water now thrown on them, pull away. Ken mo to his gun and grabs Luke's as well.
Hold him here Craig. I'm going to go help Harris. Get that signal flare off! Ken is off at a gallop.  52.
Travis, Kayla, Wade and Erin move quickly through the woo Erin suddenly makes a break...running through the woods. Kayla moves after her.
Let her go.
Hell no.
Luke sits on the ground, Craig holding his rifle on him. officer fumbles for his flare gun at the same time.
Hey you got a smoke?
Oh yeah...I got a smoke for ya. (he pulls out the flare) This is the last smoke you'll ever have. You came to the wrong damn town to rob the wrong damn bank and shoot at the wrong damn law.
That's a lot of damns. Craig holds the flare above his head, cocky.

Damn straight. As he twitches to set the flare off.... WHAM! The world explodes!! What can only be described as some HUGE BROWN MASS plows through Luke, sending him literally flying into the trees! His body hits the branch tangled upside down. Craig's scream rips through the air as blood flies across Luke's face. Luke eyes flutter open, catching a fleeting inverted image that paralyzes him: A_ brown hairy mass seems to tear the cop's body in two! Then the world turns black.  53.

Kayla moves on Erin and dives for her at a run. The two g down. Erin does her best to take Kayla out, but the robbe is an over match. Kayla rains a couple punches down on he and puts her into a choke, slowly closing down on her win pipe.

I always hated those well to do snobs that think life is going to always be there just for them. Well, guess what? No one owes you nothing! Erin throws her head back, knocking Kayla from her neck Erin rubs her throat, stares at the dazed Kayla, her eyes burning.
You don't even know me bitch! Click! A new sound.

Okay, okay. Enough of this hostility. They turn to see Travis and Wade, guns in their hands, no standing behind Kayla. Before Erin can stand, she is suddenly swept off her feet something..... Ken! The cop tackles her into the bushes!! Before the three can register what is going on...
Drop the weapons! Travis and the others turn, Harris stand off to the side, rifle trained on the robbers. The older officer is breath heavy.
Enough is enough. Let's just put those down and we'll all walk out of here. Travis clutches the money tightly, not about to run yet. Ken pops up with his gun. (CONTINUED)
As the group of robbers face off across the field from th would be captors, a_strange OUT OF FOCUS SHAPE begins to materialize behind them.
You boys are out of your league.
And you are out of your element.
You're all out of your head. Erin peers through the bushes and notes the new form movi behind them. Ken now has begun to take notice of the dark figure and his eyes widen.
What....is that behind you? Travis smirks.
Are you kidding me? Then the LOUD BREATHING....it grabs the attention of Kayl who turns slowly, her eyes finally resting on what stands behind them.
Oh my..... The others turn and the darkness comes to life.

head_text.subj: THE GIANT SIMIAN FACE OF SASQUATCH ROARS IT'S INTRODUCTIO

text: Shrouded in the dark, the eight foot tall creature is sti an ominous sight. And then it charges.... As the beast closes in on them, Travis finally aims and f as the three of them move out into the field. Ken grabs Erin and turns to Harris.
Move! The men move down the hill, the trio of robbers not far behind them. Harris turns and fires as the dark beast moves from the d trees. There is a ROAR and then the monster is gone.  55.

The group move quickly down a hill, barely stealing glanc behind them out of fear of what they might see. They move through the forest as fast as they can, stealing quick glances back occasionally as the sounds of trees snapping continues behind them. Erin turns and sees: A WOOD CABIN, old, un-cared for. She quickly turns and heads towards it
Come on. The group pushes quickly towards it.
The group blast through the front door, seeking solace in between it's flimsy walls. Wade slams the door shut
What is going on?! What the hell was that?
Check the windows. They all move to the windows.
Anything?
I don't see anything. A moment of pause and then their current situation comes into play. Travis spins his weapon at the cops.
Okay, drop em! Harris and Ken are quick with their own draw. The Mexican stand off.
Don't do this. Put ‘em down. (CONTINUED)
No cowboy...I asked first.
You guys drop them or I swear I'll start shooting. I really don't care. I'll start shooting.
Easy now son, just stay cool.
Calm down Wade. (to Harris) Now look, this is going to get us nowhere.
That's the right attitude.
We ain't putting our guns down Travis. Not now, no way.
Lady, please just relax and surrender your arms.
(agitated, scared) Not happening! I just saw the biggest, freakiest animal I have ever seen and whatever it is, it's really pissed off.
(feeling the strain) What the hell was that?
Look, we can help with this.
Oh yeah? You going to go talk to it for us? Erin, still pressed against the wall, looks out the windo the kitchen. Something LARGE moves quickly through the bushes! (CONTINUED)
She walks towards the window, crossing behind Harris in t line of fire. Everyone slowly turns to her, almost readin her thoughts.
It's out there. CRASH! A ROCK barrels throw the window, flying past Erin' head, destroying a STACK OF SHELVES. Wade FIRES out the window! Harris throws his hands up.
Hold it! Hold it! The shooting stops. Everyone remains quiet, waiting for w is to follow.
What is out there!!?? Wade looks to Ken.
Well? Go on, talk to it. Travis, takes the moment and seizes his opportunity: He s his sights on Erin.

Okay folks, time to settle this right now. I don't shoot the nice lady and we can all make it out of here okay. Wade and Kayla do the same, all three weapons trained on single target. Harris and Ken look to each other.

Luke hangs upside down from the tree branches. Blood stre down his face, his eyes shut. The CRACKLING OF TWIGS brin him slowly back to his painful life. His eyes look around blurry as the MUZZLE OF A SHOTGUN pokes him in the face. Chase leans his head in.
Well, you are still alive. (CONTINUED)
Help...help me.
Sure. Chase grabs his shirt and yanks him down...hard.
Luke looks across at Chase who sits on a rock, his shotgu across his lap, the barrel still pointed at Luke. The blo runs down Luke's hand.
How'd you find me?
Not too many gigolos out here. (beat) What are you doing hanging around in that tree? Luke becomes more alert as it all starts to come back to
Look, whatever the hell that thing was it's still out here. Chase tightens.
Thing?
Yeah. I don't know what it was. A weird gorilla. This grabs the older man's attention.
(looking for some reaffirming) Weird gorilla?
(mumbling) Thought gorillas were only in Russia or someplace.
You sure it wasn't a bear? (CONTINUED)

I don't know bears that well...But it didn't look like one. I mean it hit me like a damn truck. (lifts his hand) I think it bit me. (concern) I'm not going to turn into one of them am I? Chase's face grows alive as he looks the area over.
That's a werewolf. (beat, excited) Where was it? How big? Luke stands, trying to get his bearings, points.
Over there somewhere. Chase prods him.
Let's go. Luke moves forward, staggering.
Hurry up.
Hey...I just got my ass kicked, give me a break. Chase forcefully sticks his rifle into Luke's gut.

Your lucky I don't take you out right now! You killed a police officer and I'd have every right to gun your miserable self down. Had himself a family. Luke looks as if this may effect him...just a bit.
I tried to knock him out.
Stop here. (CONTINUED)
Luke stops as Chase scans the area, bends down to check t tracks and the blood. His face lights up.
(sotto) I knew it. I always knew it. (beat) But what are you doing?
What did you say? Chase looks back to Luke.
You stumble on to this thing feeding or something? Threaten it?
Threaten it? Let me tell you something, there is nothing that could make me threaten that thing. Chase nods, his face shows it all.
Tell me where your friends are headed.

WE MOVE with Ken ACROSS the quiet living room until we se Erin and Harris seated on the couch, gun-less. He joins them. Travis is seated at the fireplace, the warm glow lighting room. Kayla watches the windows.
So....Can one of you two fine gentleman tell me what the hell is out there? Everyone in the room is quiet. Maybe unsure...maybe too afraid to speculate.
Some help you all are. Well, it's nothing that can't be cured with enough bullets. (CONTINUED)
We're going back out there?
We're going to have to sometime. No pissed off bear is going to stand between me and my money.
Seems nothing stands between you all and your money. Some people have strange loyalties. Travis notes this key word.
Meaning?
Just what it is son. Life is all about loyalty. Question will always be, where do you place yours? Travis smiles at the older man.
You are a pretty smart ol' guy, aren't you? A lot going on upstairs in that head of yours.
Ain't no more in here than in yours partner. I've just been making the right choices. Travis is locked into this guy now, something between the
Whose the one staring down the barrel of the gun?
Is that your criteria for the right choice? Travis stands, uncomfortable.
We are going to need you two to get us safe and sound to the Canadian border. (CONTINUED)
Now it's Harris' turn to laugh.
What's so funny?

The sun bathes the mountain side with fresh new warmth. In front of the diner from the opening scene is Priscilla sweeping the porch, the routine she has done most of her life. A RENTAL CAR pulls up into the lot, stopping shy of the front. WE FOLLOW THE FEMALE LEGS as they move towards the hard working waitress. Priscilla turns to see Erin approa
Hi. (CONTINUED)
Hi there.
Are you Priscilla?
That's me. Erin reaches into her purse and pulls out the envelope.
I have something for you.
For me? What is it? Erin hands it to her.
A whole lot of hope. (beat) Don't ever let it go. Erin moves back to the car as Priscilla looks to the enve and reads the note from Luke on it:

head_text.subj: ENJOY THE RIDE TO YOUR FUTURE

text: She opens the envelope and sees the huge wad of cash. Her jaw drops as she sits on the porch, stunned. She looks up to see Erin's rental car pulling away down t dirt road. The dust swallows the car in a cloud and we he a strange sound that may be THE DISTANT SCREECH of tires....or maybe something else.
